alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 06 at 9:47PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Kentucky, Laurel. In southeast Kentucky, Knox. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 946 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving showers and thunderstorms. Excessive runoff will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tuttle, Knoxfork, Lynn Camp, Gibbs, Cranes Nest, Jarvis, Fletcher, Fariston, Lily, Green Road, Fount, Cannon and Girdler.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
